newsitem.title: USA: Open Environment faces class action suit.
newsitem.headline: Open Environment faces class action suit.

text.p: Open Environment Corp shareholders filed a class action lawsuit against the company, alleging it repeatedly overstated revenues and income that inflated the share price, plaintiff lawyers said on Thursday.

The suit, filed in a U.S. District Court against the company and 11 current or former directors and officers, alleged that Open Environment overstated revenues and income ever since its initial public offering in April 1995.
Borland International Inc acquired Open Environment in November for 0.66 Borland share for every Open Environment share. Borland was not immediately available for comment.

The lawsuit was brought on behalf of all persons and entities who bought common Open Environment stock during the period April 13, 1995 through October 10, 1996, the lawyers said. This included people who brought the stock during the initial public offering, they said.

The complaint alleged that, in the public offering registration statement and prospectus, Open Environment overstated its revenues and income for the fourth quarter and fiscal year ended December 31, 1994 and for various subsequent periods, the lawyers said.
